column5: this morning,great player and even better person RIP no.9
Mr Hockey truly one of the corner stones of the league, he will never be forgotten
Sad. Two legends in a week. They say bad things come in 3s.... Wonder who's next?  RIP Gordie

man, i swear something about this year is really crazy...like some big names are going in one big clump..  I cannot recall a year where so many people that I really hold close dying in such a short span of time. Seems like every day the past few weeks someone dies.  Malik the 5 foot freak, prince, ali, gordie, gord Tragically hip gets brain cancer...even kimbo slice died this week and I was a big fan of dude...what the heck is going on!
Kimbo needed a new heart though. He kept his health condition quiet
50 odd years before nutrition plans and off season strength training schedules?

Nah those have been around for a long time.  But thats impressive! Especially in an era when many players drank and smoked like chimneys!  Never knew he liked to fish? One more reason to like him  I think it aired last season but anyone remember as his health was failing, they had a show during an intermission that showed him with his family? How close they were and how awesome of a parent, great grand parent he was. I really enjoyed seeing that.  RIP Mr. Hockey

Gordie  loved fishing, I have a vhs show of him and Red Fisher on a trip . He was my hero when I was a boy, never missed an episode of "Hockey Night In Canada"  years ago when the original 6 played great games. R.I.P.  Mr. Hockey.
The big man upstairs is drafting.  Hes got his Anthem singer, and half time performer in Bowie and Prince, now He has his legends in Ali and Howe
